p: The model suggests that the invasion of P. ramorum in North America is still in its infancy and it is presently occupying a small fraction of its available range ( Figs. 2a and 3). All but one of the known positive detections (2696 total) of the pathogen in California and Oregon from the SODMAP data set [16] fell into the moderate to highly favourable risk areas ( Fig. 2a). This one detection, NA-1, associated with infected Umbellularia californica trees, was located in Lake county, within 10 km of areas defined as being of moderate risk ( Fig. 2a) and was a confirmed positive detection by PCR in 2006 [16].
